data.title: Only place for Pie!
data.text: Meals are  simple but  fine. Less variety than they used to have. Service is  a bit slow. Prices have gone up so much but none to compare for pie

data.title: Country Cafe style
data.text: Nice family or business restaurante with American style food,, recommend the muffins and freshly baked pies too

data.title: Casual Lunch
data.text: Stopped for lunch before a class and had an excellent chicken pot pie but never got my dessert as I was totally forgotten by my waitress.

data.title: Marie Callender's Chula Vista!
data.text: Years ago we used to go to the Movies there and we would stop in to Marie Callender's for a Quick Bloody Marry! I was always a fan of Chicken Pot Pies too. The desert Pies are so delicious and it is hard to resist any of them. As Always, I have had nothing but great service there at Marie Callender's.

data.title: An evening with Marie
data.text: You always know what you're going to get when you go to Marie Callender's.  The food and atmosphere are not fancy.  In all honesty Marie's interior could use a makeover, the dark wood and booths that look like they came from a barnyard themed restaurant are dated, but the food is still good.  I stuck with the pot roast, which had fork tender meat.  My husband ordered lighter fare, chicken with mango/avocado salsa which was almost trendy for Marie.  Excellent.  We split a piece of German chocolate pie for dessert, a bit disappointing since it was nothing more than regular chocolate filling mixed with coconut and pecans.  Meh.  There was a problem with our waiter overcharging us for the pie slice, should only be $1.99 with meal but we were charged $4.99.  That may sound like no big deal but hey, three bucks is three bucks, and we are hoping that they made it right on our credit card bill.  Other than that, a typical meal with Marie which is a good thing.

data.title: Very good place for lunch and dinner
data.text: Traditional american food, excels in their pies, but the rest of the food is very good as well.Family and business oriented place, with good service.

data.title: Lived up to Marie Calender's reputation.
data.text: Looked forward to the Chicken Pot Pie, and was not disappointed. I forgot what kind of pie we had for dessert, but it was good also.

data.title: There  chichen pot pie.
data.text: I really like this place. I have eaten here many times. I recommend this one because it has the best pot pie. Also  there corn bread  is also  good.

data.title: Entertaining Guests
data.text: I have to share, I ate there two weeks ago the food was awesome. I ate there this last week and I would never order that soup again. Service great and it was a large group of 14 but I did not want spaghetti sauce for a soup base for Chicken Tortilla Soup. ARRRG

data.title: Love their pies!
data.text: Have only gone for their pies because they are so good.  Parking is very close and the rest of the food is very good but the last few times were for a pie.

data.title: Great for Breakfast
data.text:
Most people know of Marie Calendars -  their lunches, dinners, and pies -  but most don't
know that the Marie Calendars in Chula Vista, Ca, has a GREAT breakfast menu, and starts
serving breakfast weekdays at 7:00 A.M.!  There are three or four different menus to choose
from, and one really good one has three choices for UNDER FIVE DOLLARS - one of them is
a Three-Cheese Omelet with hash browns, and when you get coffee, it is just under $8.00!
They always bring some warm bread and butter before the breakfast comes.  I have a
business meeting there at least once a month -  great food, great and quick service, and
the server will give everyone their own individual bill -  a lot of restaurants will not allow
that!  You won't find many buys like this anymore  -

data.title: How does this place stay in business?
data.text: I came here with my father and my son. I hadn't been in a Marie Callendar's in years, and I thought it used to be a pretty good restaurant. The salad bar is a joke, especially for a California restaurant. It was low-quality food all around. You'd be better off going to the salad bar at your local grocery store. We shared a slice of pie for dessert. It was ok; not great. This chain used to be much better. Whatever corporation owns it now needs to either do a re-haul or put us out of our misery and close it down.

data.title: Great Sunday Champagne Brunch
data.text: We have been here many times.  It is a great little brunch in the middle of quaint downtown Chula Vista.  The brunch runs about $17.00 with unlimited champagne.  They serve the usual fair along with eggs benedict and waffles.  Give it a try!

data.title: Always good
data.text: We have had their Sunday brunch many times.  It is well worth the $15-16 per person.  Lots of items to choose.  I've also had lunch there and love their choices.  The southwestern chicken salad is one of my favorites, but they also have other dishes that are comfort foods.  Pies are yummy.

data.title: Slow, slow, slow!   The food was OK, but the kitchen did not help...
data.text: The menu offers old fashioned dishes, most of which have good taste and value.  The pies are often the highlight.  There isn't enough business here to warrant added servers, but the servers seem overworked.  The kitchen is remarkably SLOW getting the food out, so it isn't always the server's fault.  Food generally comes to the table hot --which points to the kitchen as the slowdown.  It is a reasonable fallback when other choices just don't make it.

data.title: Very disappointing, used to be so good.
data.text:
My extended family & I went to Marie Callender's in Chula Vista. I have been there many times before & mostly enjoyed it. Not this time. 

I have an extreme allergy to cheese, get extremely nauseous. I have always enjoyed their chili & cornbread. After all these years I am always very adamant that the cheese be left off.

When the chili arrived, I didn't see any cheese. I always stir the crisp toppings & onions into the chili before digging in. When I took the spoon out, there were strings of cheese clinging to the spoon! Thank God, I had not yet taken a bite.  We couldn't find the waitress anywhere. Finally, after over 15 minutes I had to go to the counter to get help.  25 minutes later the waitress appeared. She insisted that there was no cheese so I had to prove it to her by showing her.  She apologized & took it away. Obviously, the cook had put cheese on top out of habit & then realizing what he had done, had tried to scoop it out. But you simply can't scoop out melted cheese. This was a very careless thing to do. He should have made a new bowl. By the time I got my bowl of "cheeseless" chili, everyone else had almost finished eating.

The menu states that the chili comes with cornbread. Also cornbread is brought to the table for everyone. When I got my chili, there was one square of cornbread left in the bread basket, which was cold. I asked the waitress if I could please have the cornbread (hot) that was included in the price of my meal. She told me that she would get in trouble... that she had been told they couldn't bring any more cornbread until it was all gone! I was tempted to throw it on the floor, but my son took it on his plate so the waitress would bring the bread. 

To add insult to injury, the new bowl of chili was only lukewarm. But everyone was finished & just waiting on me so I downed about half of it, wrapped the piece of cornbread that finally arrived in a napkin & took it home.

Was this fiasco the waitress? Or the cook? Or is something else going on with the management? (Or all the above).  We also noticed that the restaurant has been stripped of most of it's decorations... bare walls, etc..  And the salad bar is a joke, no more hot bacon dressing & very few condiments.

On a brighter note, there was a sale on their pies, so I bought a custard pie to take home.  This was one of the tastiest, freshest custard pies I've had in years! Cudos to the pie!

data.title: Agradable velada
data.text: Excelente opción y de carta muy variada para todos los gustos. lo visitamos en la cena y nos gustó mucho la variedad de platillos que solicitamos. de servicio atento y esmerado, con buen ambiente y tranquilo.
